title: Do I Smell As Bad As I Look?
body:
Small request, but could this quote be redirected towards a specific champion rather than male champions as a whole? It’s kinda offensive?
Might I recommend the obvious Twitch who’s known and proud of his stench? 
Or perhaps at Graves who apparently doesn’t know hygiene outside of his beard? (Based off Neeko’s other quote towards him)

Edit: Changed sexist to offensive since people were getting rather hot and bothered over this

replies.body: Imagine if Neeko was a male chameleon and after changing into the form of a woman commented on how weak she was. Don't think that would have made it into the game....
I dont understand how being called smelly equates to something women have been oppressed over for many years during the feminist movement.

Bottom line is it's insulting.

Pretty sure that was what he was trying to say.
Well, to be fair.... how many of leagues male champions look like they bathe at all besides Taric?

None expected Graves to be walking rose garden, I believe? He lives in Bilgewater, where sea food overwhelms the entire region with its smell, which is moist too due to sea (holds the heat and cause sweating). He is also pretty active, another reason to sweat a lot.

But with that beard and hair, it is really unbelivable he doesn't shower at least once in 3 days.

Lets assume, Neeko is a sexist champion.
There are some champions that are thieves {{champion:81}} , some are murderers {{champion:412}}, they all have tons of lines referencing this. So, why are you morally outraged at Neekos personality and more importantly, why are you directing that outrage towards riot?

Personally, I hate neekos personality. Its extremely immature, and stupid. But that's not really a reason to change it.

I understand that she’s uncomfortable turning into males and that’s well expressed with her other two quotes that trigger by doing so. But it’s rather unnecessary to say that she looks bad and smells bad just because she’s male now. 

And I get that if you’re not attracted to a certain group you’re not going to say they’re gorgeous and you’d be dtf if you could but just because you’re not attracted to them doesn’t mean for you to straight up say they’re all ugly and smell bad as a whole. 



In a fighting game where killing is the mission, murderers and thieves being here makes sense but none of them discriminate against a specific group for physical factors. Most discrimination is directed towards the faction you’re in or if you’re an undead monster who’s trying to kill everything that moves. The only racism(species-ism?) I know of is: Vastayans who hate what humans, primarily Noxians for what they have done to Ionia. Illaoi and some others who don’t like Yordles because of their magical nature which separates them from Runeterra and maybe the ascended because they’re giant threats for anyone on their bad side.

Edit: regardless I’m not outraged or anything over the subject nor do I care about her personality, it’s just this one quote which is unnecessary and while it could be perceived as childish it’s not needed in addition to her other childish quotes

From what I can see, Thresh killing people makes him a "bad guy," but Neeko's constant insults to men (and unwanted advances toward women) are supposed to make her cute and endearing.

Why does it matter that a fictional character is sexist or not?  Jhin is a serial killer.  Does this mean Riot supports murder?  Xayah is an obvious racist.  Does this mean Riot supports racism?  Maybe Neeko is a sexist.  Why does it matter if a fictional character who has absolutely nothing to do with real life is sexist towards other fictional characters who also have absolutely nothing to do with real life?

Mind you, IIRC, there is not a SINGLE CHAMPION in League who makes any sorta of comments on the female gender as Neeko does. In fact, 90% of the roster don't even have any gender-specific voicelines at all.

I like Neeko and all, but some of her voicelines are really pushing it. I love that she's our first openly LGBT Champion, but some of this just makes it look slapped on. If we are actually going to keep these quotes "Because they're in a humorous manner," it'd only be fair if we get something similar on the opposite side of the spectrum; jokes about women (innocent ones please, nothing that devalues or objectify women), but even that won't go very far considering how much of a controversey that'd be.

Any female stereotypes? You mean like 90% of the female rooster being feminine, slender, and all in all, attractive? Not one of the female champs has below-shoulder-length hair, and from what I can see, many of them have makeup. Why aren't there any fat girls with short hair? Why aren't there any girls who are blind, bald, disfigured, ugly, tomboyish? You see only what you want to see.

Also, her comments are actually realistic. She's a teenager who likes girls, of course she's gonna think that men are gross, ugly, and smelly. Yes, it's a stereotype, but it's a stereotype that even in reality, girls of that age are very familiar with. Hell, I have a lesbian friend who'd use exactly those words to explain why she dislikes men - they often smell of sweat, they are gross with their burping, not shaving, and whatnot, and girls are much prettier. 

And what do you mean by "pushing it"? You're offended? So don't play her. Are you gonna get mad if you hear that line in game, are you gonna feel insulted by a game character? Hell, I couldn't care less if there was a champion calling women weak or unworthy, as long as there was an actual explanation for it (Neeko is a lesbian, she's "allowed to" dislike men). Actually, I think Evelynn insults women more than any male champ could, with her being a milder version of a succubus, pretty much using her sexuality. Or Miss Fortune, who's more of a joke than an actual captain or a leader. Why do so many female champs need to have that aspect of seducing men? Even Ahri with her "charm". Ever thought of that? Bet not.

>Not one of the female champs has below-shoulder-length hair

Elise, Quinn, Camille, Vi just from the top of my head.

>Why aren't there any girls who are blind, bald, disfigured, ugly, tomboyish?

Lissandra is both blind and disfigured. Vi and Quinn are pretty tomboyish, possibly Taliyah too. Sejuani (oh look, another short-haired woman) and Illaoi fit the strong/buff acrhetype. And more.

As for "ugly", Riot has been phasing out "ugly" from their game for quite some time. When "hideous" champions get reworked, they adopt a much cleaner look; while you wouldn't call, say, Urgot beautiful, what's left of his flesh is far from fat, scar-ridden monstrosity he used to be. This also shows with new champions; Pyke who's pretty much a drowned zombie is a well-built, and I dare even say attractive human male with only a glowing eye to indicate his true nature. Ugly champions simply aren't a thing anymore, male or female.

>Also, her comments are actually realistic. She's a teenager who likes girls, of course she's gonna think that men are gross, ugly, and smelly. Yes, it's a stereotype, but it's a stereotype that even in reality, girls of that age are very familiar with. Hell, I have a lesbian friend who'd use exactly those words to explain why she dislikes men - they often smell of sweat, they are gross with their burping, not shaving, and whatnot, and girls are much prettier.

You seem to be missing the point the person you are replying to was trying to make. Teenage boys also have similar stereotypes about girls; however if those made it in-game as a huge part of champions' interactions accusations of sexism would be all over the place. No defense of "those comments are actually realistic", "I have a gay friend who uses those words to explain why he dislikes women" or "they are in a humorous manner" would stop raging SJWs from tearing Riot apart.

As for if anyone is "offended" - you don't have to be offended to not like someone's personality/attitude. League is full of charming individuals such as serial killers, racist dirtbags, self-absorbed narcissists, violent thugs, ruthless dictators, mad scientist and many more. Having a sexist character (even if it's up to debate) suddenly doesn't seem as bad - but believe me, if said sexist character happened to be male he'd automatically be branded much worse than all of the above by SJWs.

It sounds to me like you're saying that because you THINK that SJWs would attack the male champion saying similar things, you're complaining about Neeko? And I should believe you that they would complain even worse, even though I, as a girl, just told you that I personally wouldn't care... Okay.

You're once again only seeing what you want to see; I'm not complaining about Neeko at all. Literally, there isn't a single sentence in my post complaining about her. Unless you consider the "people might not like her attitude" part complaining when it is just a fact (not to mention next-level cherry picking) - no champion will 100% appeal to everyone. 

What I'm doing is commenting on double standards that would most surely be applied if Neeko was a dude using negative "teen boy" stereotypes in his interaction with women. You personally wouldn't care - good for you. But companies have been accused of being sexist by rabid SJWs for far less, so there is no doubt that would happen.

All I am going to say is that because it is a female champ people are going to attribute it to "personality" and being cheeky vs sexism a lot easier than if it was a male champ making some comment regarding all female champs. I don't really think it is sexism (but I also think a portion of what people deem sexist towards woman also is not sexist in most contexts). 

Also really?

a) If Riot put in a male champ with a comment regarding females such as "Do I sound as dumb as I look?" (or some comment regarding looking like a bimbo) I am pretty sure people would take that as sexist, not humorous. 
b) No comment, I am really not into lore so can't speak about this but if her comment is only targeted towards one side then I have to say this line of reasoning seems fairly flawed. 

I just find it interesting how double standards exist in this area. I don't find it offensive (just like I wouldn't find it offensive the other way) but I just find the double standards portion a tad off as I know Riot wouldn't put in any comment the other direction.

Something my wife and I agreed on is, it would be a lot cuter and charming if instead of the whole "ugly/smelly" thing, Neeko could go for the typical child-like "cooties".

Taunting male champ, "ewww gross, you have cooties"
Transforming into male, "*Gasp*, does Neeko have cooties now"?!

Would love to see quotes for the more "personality inclined" champs:

 Being Syndra, Zyra, Evelynn etc: "ughhh, Neeko back hurts".

Being MF: "It hurts Neeko to walk like this".
I need the MF one now. RITO YOU HAVE TO

You know what really upsets me? 

"Do I look as bad as I smell?" isn't a {{champion:29}} interaction quote.

The whole quote is asinine to me because even through shapeshifting I have trouble believing that she just assumes the smell as well. Especially when it comes from things like sweat and dirt. Smell doesn't just magically appear.
Although this point is probably open for discussion.

That she uses the line for all males is just plain retarded because no matter what your sexuality is, you still have a basic sense of beauty that goes beyond the sexes. You don't have to attracted to someone to find that person beautiful, like wth?
